did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.abstract: Typescript of a ribald poem mocking Kaiser Wilhelm by an unknown American soldier entitled, "If Poetry is the Essence of Thought."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World War I Peom, n.d., in the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection, Accession #10875-aj, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The poem was given to the University of Virginia Library by Paul Collinge, Heartwood Books, Charlottesville, Virginia, through Matthew J. Bruccoli, on November 8, 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection consists of a undated typescript of a poem entitled "If Poetry is the Essence of Thought" by an unknown author, relating in graphic and vulgar language the emotions and thoughts of a World War I soldier.
